name: Contributory Negligence
rule: Under tort law, in Contributory Negligence, plaintiff is barred from recovery if he acted negligently and helped to cause the accident.
elementsQuestions: Here plaintiff helped to cause accident because ...
conclusion: Therefore, under contributory negligence theory, Plaintiff will be barred of any recovery.
description: In Contributory Negligence, if plaintiff is the reason of injury then he is barred from all recovery. A plaintiff can be barred from recovery for being 1% or more fault for an accident. For example, if a plaintiff is speeding in her car and another car cuts her off, she will not be able to recover if the jury determines she is even 1% at fault for speeding.

sample_essays.hypo: Heena is speeding in her car at 100 mph and Amar is in another car cuts her off, will Heena recover?
sample_essays.explanation:
Under tort law, in Contributory Negligence, plaintiff is barred from recovery if he acted negligently and helped to cause the accident.

Here Heena acted Negligently because she was driving her car at 100 mph. Also Heena helped to cause accident because she was speeding her car and Amar's car cuts her off which causes accident. If she would be driving at slow speed, then accident could have been avoided.

Therefore, under contributory negligence theory, Heena will be barred of any recovery.
